sentence.Network_en: Two days later, they implanted the fertilized eggs back inside me.
sentence.Network_cn: 两天以后，他们把受精卵重新植入了我的体内。

sentence.Network_en: She nestled the eggs safely in the straw in Jim's basket.
sentence.Network_cn: 她把鸡蛋轻轻地放在吉姆篮子里的稻草上。

sentence.Network_en: They are prolific breeders, with many hens laying up to six eggs.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们都是多产的饲养员，养的母鸡很多都可以下6个蛋之多。

entry.def: An egg is an oval object that is produced by a female bird and which contains a baby bird. Other animals such as reptiles and fish also lay eggs.

example.ex: ...a baby bird hatching from its egg.

entry.tran: （西方国家常指供食用的）鸡蛋
entry.def: In Western countries, eggs often means hen's eggs, eaten as food.

example.ex: Break the eggs into a shallow bowl and beat them lightly.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋打到一个浅碗中，轻轻搅打。

entry.def: Egg is used to refer to an object in the shape of a hen's egg.
An egg is a cell that is produced in the bodies of female animals and humans. If it is fertilized by a sperm, a baby develops from it.

example.ex: It only takes one sperm to fertilize an egg.
example.tran: 只需要一个精子就能让卵子受精。

entry.tran: 寄希望于一件事上;孤注一掷
entry.def: If someone puts all their eggs in one basket, they put all their effort or resources into doing one thing so that, if it fails, they have no alternatives left.

example.ex: The key word here is diversify; don't put all your eggs in one basket.
example.tran: 这里的关键词是多样性；不要在一棵树上吊死。

entry.def: If someone has egg on their face or has egg all over their face, they have been made to look foolish.

example.ex: If they take this game lightly they could end up with egg on their faces.
example.tran: 如果他们对这场比赛掉以轻心，结果很可能会出丑。

means.word_mean: 1. oval reproductive body of a fowl (especially a hen) used as food

slang.tokens: You can’t make an omelet without breaking eggs.

list.explanation: (谚语)不打破鸡蛋,煎不出蛋饼。有失才有得。

Sentence.sentence: So when fly the north, they might lay eggs in Louisiana and die.
The eggs of that following generation may be found in Kentucky, the eggs of next generation may be in the Kang Michigan.
